1:
A gentle answer turns away wrath,
\q but a harsh word stirs up anger.
\q
2:
The tongue of wise people compliments knowledge,
\q but the mouth of fools pours out folly.
3:
The eyes of Yahweh are everywhere,
\q keeping watch over the evil and the good.
\q
4:
A healing tongue is a tree of life,
\q but a deceitful tongue crushes the spirit.
5:
A fool has contempt for his father's instruction,
\q but he who learns from correction is prudent.
\q
6:
In the house of the righteous person there is great treasure,
\q but the earnings of the wicked person give him trouble.
7:
The lips of wise people scatter knowledge about,
\q but not so the hearts of fools.
\q
8:
Yahweh hates the sacrifices of wicked people,
\q but the prayer of upright people is his delight.
9:
Yahweh hates the way of wicked people,
\q but he loves the one who pursues what is right.
\q
10:
Harsh discipline awaits anyone who forsakes the way
\q and he who hates correction will die.
12:
The mocker resents correction;
\q he will not go to the wise.
13:
A joyful heart makes the face cheerful,
\q but heartache crushes the spirit.
\q
14:
The heart of the discerning seeks knowledge,
\q but the mouth of fools feeds on folly.
15:
All the days of oppressed people are miserable,
\q but a cheerful heart has an unending feast.
\q
16:
Better is little with the fear of Yahweh
\q than great treasure with confusion.
17:
Better is a meal with vegetables where there is love
\q than a fatted calf served with hatred.
\q
18:
An angry man stirs up arguments,
\q but a person who is slow to anger quiets a quarrel.
19:
The path of the sluggard is like a place with a hedge of thorns,
\q but the path of the upright is a built-up highway.
\q
20:
A wise son brings joy to his father,
\q but a foolish person despises his mother.
21:
Folly delights a person who lacks sense,
\q but the one who has understanding walks a straight path.
\q
22:
Plans go wrong where there is no advice,
\q but with numerous advisors they succeed.
24:
The path of life leads upward for prudent people,
\q that they may turn away from Sheol beneath.
25:
Yahweh tears down the legacy of the proud,
\q but he protects the property of the widow.
\q
26:
Yahweh hates the thoughts of wicked people,
\q but the words of kindness are pure.
27:
The robber brings trouble to his family,
\q but the one who hates bribes will live.
\q
28:
The heart of the righteous person ponders before it answers,
\q but the mouth of wicked people pours out all its evil.
29:
Yahweh is far away from wicked people,
\q but he hears the prayer of righteous people.
\q
30:
The light of the eyes brings joy to the heart
\q and good news is health to the body.
31:
If you pay attention when someone corrects how you live,
\q you will remain among wise people.
\q
32:
The one who rejects discipline despises himself,
\q but he who listens to correction gains understanding.
33:
The fear of Yahweh teaches wisdom
\q and humility comes before honor.
